messages.content: My name is Pam. I work full time in the NHS. As a disabled woman, I’ve been fighting for equality all my life. Think politicians are all the same? I promise you’ll spot the difference in Glasgow North.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I believe that we should remain in the EU and in the UK. I’ll fight for Scotland’s place in the world as part of the UK and a proud member of the EU because together we are stronger.

I’ll fight for more employment rights, a real living wage of £10 an hour for everyone (including under 18s), for an end to zero hours contracts, to close the gender pay gap & for pension justice for the WASPI women.

I’ll fight for a Universal Basic Income, to defend the Human Rights Act, for more rights for workers, women, disabled people & LGBTQ+ people. I’ll fight against the hostile environment & I’ll fight for a more equal society.

issues.brexitEurope: I believe that we should remain in the EU and in the UK. I’ll fight for Scotland’s place in the world as part of the UK and a proud member of the EU because together we are stronger.
issues.labourEmployment: I’ll fight for more employment rights, a real living wage of £10 an hour for everyone (including under 18s), for an end to zero hours contracts, to close the gender pay gap & for pension justice for the WASPI women.
issues.socialWelfare: I’ll fight for a Universal Basic Income, to defend the Human Rights Act, for more rights for workers, women, disabled people & LGBTQ+ people. I’ll fight against the hostile environment & I’ll fight for a more equal society.

community.content: I’ve campaigned for equality and social justice my whole life. When I was 18 months old, my family discovered I had Juvenile Arthritis and by the age of 5 I was in a wheelchair. My mum and dad taught me to be a fighter, to use my voice. So that’s what I do now, I use my voice to stand up for human rights and for the NHS where I work - because we need to fight for them. People said that I’d never be able to go up by myself, so I made it my business to stand up for me. They also said I’d never make it to the top of my party. I ask you to give me the chance to stand up for you in Parliament.

leaflet.personalStatement: I’ve campaigned for equality and social justice my whole life. When I was 18 months old, my family discovered I had Juvenile Arthritis and by the age of 5 I was in a wheelchair. My mum and dad taught me to be a fighter, to use my voice. So that’s what I do now, I use my voice to stand up for human rights and for the NHS where I work - because we need to fight for them. People said that I’d never be able to go up by myself, so I made it my business to stand up for me. They also said I’d never make it to the top of my party. I ask you to give me the chance to stand up for you in Parliament.

endorsements.endorsement: A decade of austerity & cuts have shaken our country to its core. Pam is a seasoned disability rights activist with a track fight tirelessly for all of us ordinary people against Boris Johnson & his toxic gain of elites. Nobody is better places to represent the people of Glasgow North.

examples: a real living wage of £10 an hour for everyone (including under 18s)
I promise you’ll spot the difference in Glasgow North.
I promise you’ll spot the difference in Glasgow North.
I believe that we should remain in the EU and in the UK.
My pledges to you: CAMPAIGN TO REMAIN IN AN REFORM BOTH THE UK AND THE EU

personalStories.story: I’ve campaigned for equality and social justice my whole life. When I was 18 months old, my family discovered I had Juvenile Arthritis and by the age of 5 I was in a wheelchair. My mum and dad taught me to be a fighter, to use my voice. So that’s what I do now, I use my voice to stand up for human rights and for the NHS where I work - because we need to fight for them. People said that I’d never be able to go up by myself, so I made it my business to stand up for me. They also said I’d never make it to the top of my party. I ask you to give me the chance to stand up for you in Parliament.

examples: A decade of austerity & cuts have shaken our country to its core. Pam is a seasoned disability rights activist with a track fight tirelessly for all of us ordinary people against Boris Johnson & his toxic gain of elites. Nobody is better places to represent the people of Glasgow North.
Boris Johnson & his toxic gang of elites.
I promise you’ll spot the difference in Glasgow North.
